text:
Bottle 375ml. corked and clear glass @ [ (Chris and Ruths pre-GBBF tasting 2015) by chriso - London ]. [ As La Face Cachée de la Pomme Neige Méthode Traditionnelle - (Cidre de glace mousseux - Sparkling) ].ABV: 12.5%. Clear light to medium orange - amber yellow color with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate to heavy apple, riped apples, sweet apple, apple syrup, cooked apples - apple pie, apple concentrate. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet with a long long duration, apple, spple syrup - apple concentrate, alcohol. Body is medium to full, texture is syrupy, carbonation is flst, finidh feel is light to moderate alcoholic. So nice ... wow just love good ice ciders :) [20150808]
 9-3-9-5-17

Poured from bottle thanks Willrunforbeer 2012 vintage deep amber with nice lacing and a quick dissapating head. Aromas of honey juicy apple and caramel. Taste is sweet juicy apples moderate acidity luscious mouth feel notes of alcohol cinnamon and a wonderfully balanced finish. Exceptional.

2012 bottle. Pours bright mahogany with a few Tory bubbles. Aroma is sweet baked apples. Flavor is overall sweet apple with just enough tart apple to balance. A touch of raisin speaks of the age of the brew. Very nice with light carbonation and very tiny bubbles.

Bottle shared at the 2015 edition of the chriso Pre-GBBF tasting - London. Cheers! Pours clear, rich copper with a few bubbles. Hearty, ripe apples in the nose, with suggestions of tang. Big sweet flavour with syrupy apples, moderate acidity, apple sauce. Full bodied with fine, spritzy carbonation. Warming finish with light acidic sting, rich caramelised apples. Delicious. Outstanding.

A few samples at the ice cider festival in Montreal with Paul. After a few years of attending, the typical vendor has shaken out to offering a dry / sparkling cider, an ice cider, and usually some sort of cuvvee, winter blend or special vintage ice cider. In the past two years Ive noticed some cideries starting to present an additional offering - a sparkling cider. Like most of their other products, La Face nails it out of the park with this one. Such a strange mouthfeel which combines the typical thickness and viscocity of an ice cider with some bubbly carbonation throughout. A touch sweeter than youd expect but it works so well. Sweet apples, sugars, honey and bright maple glides over the tongue. Great stuff.Earlier Rating: 2/16/2015 Total Score: 4Bottle sampled at Mondial 2015 in Montreal with Linh, Ken and Nica. Pours a thick golden body with light bubbles. The pour alone reveals this to be different than many of the other sparkling ciders and it seems to truly be a hybrid of the sparkling and ice cider styles. Mouthfeel is a amalgamation of bubbly, thick sweet apple syrup with notes of rich sweet honey, apple pie, sweet sugar, light oak, earthy character and maybe even some cheese. Not sure why I didnt pick up a bottle of this. Really good stuff.

Bottle, split with jaodesaulniers. Clear rich gold amber pour with tiny sparkles of carbonation slowly rising through the viscous liquid. Aroma is pretty classic, Neige sets a standard, baked apple, caramel, cooked apple, light spice. Taste is very sweet, rich, liquory apple flavor with just a hint of spice. Palate is full bodied, can barely feel the carbonation if at all, very thin. Delicious, although I wonder why they bother with carbonation.

Thick, sticky toffee apples on the nose and mouth. Little carbonation. Long legs on the glass. A hint of funk. stewed apples, some cinammon .Long, sticky, syrupy finish. Perhaps a bit over the hill now, but still a fantastic drop.
Thick honey brown, near still and then carbonation rushes to the surface. Aroma of baked apple pie, honey, dark fruit. Taste is sugary sweet, delicious apple, honey, strawberry, maaaan

Bottle share at Chrisos. Dark orange amber, brown hue, still, no real head. Aroma is sweet syrupy apple, strawberries and honey. Body is medium, smooth, no real carbonation. Taste is honey sweet but with tart appley acidity cutting through it, strawberries and redcurrant. Nice stuff.

Bottle at Pre-GBBF Shindig 2015. It pours clear deep amber with a quickly dissipating head. The nose is rich, juicy, unctuous, sweet apple pie, pear, toasted sugars and candy. The taste is crisp, bitter- sweet, oily, apple pie, candied stuff, cinnamon, alcohol warmth, nice fruity tartness and some Golden Delicious apple with a slick finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Brilliant balance and high drinkability. Damn tasty I say.
Neige pom prem Bottle at pre GBBF 2015. Ice cider wow best aroma today. Apple going brown apple skins. Bruised caramel apple skin flavour. Amazing. Toffee sweet. Apple. Amazing.

UPDATED: JAN 7, 2016 Bottle at Chris and Ruths Shindig 2015. Clear orange/amber color with a small head. Fruity overripe apple aroma, syrup, caramel, grapes, pear notes, some nice sweetness. Fruity overripe apple flavor, overripe pears, raisins, sugary, caramel, warming alcohol, overripe pears, yeast notes, sugary, some grapes. Absolutely wonderful!

Tasting at Matts, corked bottle, vintage 2012, 3+ years oldBright dark golden color. Deep aroma, harmonious, ripe fruits. Sweet, sour, a bit astringent, with just a soft carbonation; not much caramel, but stewed apples yes.Wonderful, again.
Bottle - Cooked apples, dark caramel, light vinegar and brown sugar. Clear copper. Very mellow, refined brown sugars Nd wonderful over ripe Apple. Very nice.

2012 vintage. 375mL bottle, pours a hazy vibrant orange with bubbles due to the sparkling. Nose is complex as hell, with toffee, caramel, butterscotch, that kind of thing, with syrupy apples, and lots of residual sugars. Flavour is similar, with complex butterscotch, caramel, syrupy apples, and a hint of acidity. The carbonation isnt even really noticeable -- maybe a hint of the bubbles. Another sublime product from the masters.

Bottle (375 ml). As "Neige Méthode Traditionnelle". Split 4-ways, 

Appearance: Clear bright golden/copper, leaving some nice legs on the glass. 

Aroma: Yellow fruits (pears, tropical fruits), burnt caramel, freshly harvested red apples and light sweetness notes.

Taste: Burnt caramel, freshly harvested red apples, yellow fruits, light acidity and light to moderate residual sugars. Alcohol is well hidden.

Palate: Medium body. Sparkling (soft) carbonation. The bubbles clean the sticky sweetness that is usually present is La Face Cachée ice ciders so the finish is a lot less sweeteer than in their other products. 

Overall: The bubbles makes this Ice Cider a bit more drinkable than the usual La Face Cachée products, but it also hinder the complexity, the juicy apples mouthfeel and the sticky sweet finish, It also make the product tast a bit "cheaper". Not bad, but 9 times out of 10 I will choose the regular Neige Premiere over this one.

Thanks Tommy for sharing.

A - Very dark golden bronze color. still but a nice cork pop 

S - Nose has a bit of cherry, pear and nectarine with a lot of residual sweetness.

T - Interesting taste, has a bit less sweetness than regular Premiere. Sharp granny smith apple, I get some old citrus. bubbles detract from the taste a bit.

M - Nice bubbly mouth feel, residual sugar finish. tart at the finish as well.

O - This is a nice cider, tart finish, sweet up front, a bit more child-like, like a welchs carbonated apple juice. tasty but not worth revisiting for the cost.

2009 Vintage bottle. Pours with a clear deep golden hued body with a small white ring of foam, some legs and light yeast floaties. Aromas are amazing La Face ice cider (its been too long since Ive had one of these). Lightly cheesy, with intense vibrant apple, strong acidity, tannin, warming baking spices. Incredibly vibrant! Flavors are sweet and strongly acidic. Both are extremely strong and would be completely unbalanced without the other. Carbonation is petilant, and doesnt add much to this already unbelievable beverage. Huge acidity, lemony, vibrant apple. An absolutely wonderful dessert wine. As with any La Face Cachee product, this is a complete gem!

375 ml. bottle shared with Kraddel during the (Ice) Cider/Perry tasting @ Barely Legal Tasting Room. 2009 Vintage. Obtained in a trade with tom10101. Thank you! Drank almost half of the bottle. Pours very dark caramel amber, has this spend time on barrels? Nose is warming spirit-like, boozy, syrupy apple, Sirop de Liège, La Face Cachée de la Pomme-style but tad more overtly spirit-like. Warming sirop de Liège, spirit apple, warming, boozy, thick caramel, brown sugar, cinnamon, red apple. Carbonation is only light, I was hopping secretly for a Champagne-type of deal but that is just me. Absolutely awesome but not mind-blowing like Recolte DHiver unfortunately.

Big thnx to ships for this one . 
Pours clear , amberblonde . Small ring of foam . 
Smell is sweet , full . 
Taste is sweet, full, booze, sharp , oaky almost. Perfect carbo . Very intense , carbo lightens it all up . 
Easy drinkable. too damn easy !

Bottle care of a trade with TimE. Orange, rusty, almost pink, effervescent, no head, oily in the glass. Nose is sweet, sugary, syrupy, red apple skins, something like an old plastic bucket, icing sugar, tart tatin (caramelised apple tart), minerals. Taste is sweet apple, some subtle apple bitterness, red flesh apple, some vinous sweet grape, caramel. Its very much in the sweet wine category. A little bit of that sunshine Sauternes grape sweetness, but with sweet and bitter apple notes. Really very nice. Nose is very sweet caramelly and then on the taste theres some nice apple sweetness and light acidic.

Bottle @ 10K + OT. Thanks to Steve for sending me this. Minimal sparkle on this sparkling cider, but a rich caramel colored pour and good clarity. Smell is fresh apple tart, vanilla, caramel, and tart green apple. Great cinnamon and nutmeg, too. Flavor is liquid apple pie. Hints of cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, and vanilla. Rich caramelized sugar and baked apple. Perfect acidity on the finish. Coats the tongue. Wonderful.

[ Bottle ][ brokensail ][ 375ml ][ 10K+OT Tasting ][ Stemless Wine Taster ][ 5/3/14 ]
>> Low to no pop from the cork. Clear, deep tea orange, no foam, huge legs. Nose is insanely rich as always apple pie with melted cheese topping. Taste is super sweet cinnamon apple pie that is never cloying by some evil magic. Finishes with spice and powerful acid that kills the front palates sugariness. Low carbonation to zero. Oily, ultra rich mouthfeel. Huge legs. Cheesy oily sugary front palate. Awesome as always from this producer.
Delicious. An explosion of apple flavor. Quite sweet but theres a ton of depth. Earthy and thick. Viscous. Lingering tart apple aftertaste.

Aroma is very apple forward with lots of red apple character. Fairly sweet with some alcohol in the finish. 
Pours a clear copper with some ruby and good notes. Light carbonation but no head or lacing. Viscous with moderate sized legs. 
Flavor is very sweet with a very nice apple flavor. So sweet and full of overripe red apples. Hints of alcohol in the finish but not hot at all. Lingering sweet red apple qualities. 
Mouthfeel is medium light bodied with low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
Overall this cider is so easy drinking and flavorful. Sweet apple character persists with only hints of the alcohol notes. This is a really nice cider.

Bottle at home, thanks yespr and Kyotolefty.
Clear orange coloured with a small white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of apples and dried apples.
Sweet and fruity flavour of apple juice and dried apples with some acidity and notes of apples.
Fruity finish of apples.
Bottle at Fermentoren - Tasting - Thanks to Kyotolefty. Clear amber/pink - no head. High apples, sweet red apples, red apple zesty, light acid, sweetness, nice acid notes, nice balance, earthy.

Bottled. An amber beer with no head. The aroma has notes of over ripe apples and alcohol. The flavor is very sweet with strong notes of alcohol, over ripe apples, and lemons, leading to a dry alcoholc finish.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours clear golden orange with no head. Aroma is smooth apples and mild citric. Dense apples. Smooth fruity, thick apples to syrupy. Lingering apples fruity finish.

Bottle,2009 vintage, on 07/17/2013, thanks to TimE! Pours clear, burnt amber, thin head fades relatively quickly, fine champagne bubbles rising in the glass. Aroma is crisp, sweet apple, light tart notes as well, honey, vanilla, faint caramel. Aroma is intensely sweet green apple to balance an almost equal tartness, orange, bright honey with a light spicy finish, lingering apple in a long aftertaste. Thick body, almost syrupy with subtle carbonation. Wow, great dessert drink, something really different and delicious.

Bottle shared by Darkguardian. Clear light amber pour with a faint white head. Apple and vinegar aromas. Complex with tart green apple and smooth caramel notes. Tasty and strong with a very nice mouthfeel.

Bottle... This cider rocks! Pours clear and light amber with college cheerleader-like legs. The aroma offers big-time sweet red apple and a whisper of toasted oak. Full-bodied and silky with lazy carbonation. The flavor is sweet and complex - McIntosh apples, malic acid and vanilla are highlights. Lengthy sweet-tart finish. This world class ice cider was shared with the South Florida Brew Crew by darkguardian!

UPDATED: JAN 1, 2013 Bottle at home with apple pie. Lovely orange amber, clear but oily and slick. No head or bubbles. Nose of apple, honey, light spice, sherbert,, light tannic skin. Got better as it warmed, but the flavor was another level. Sweet apple, light acid, honey, orange, with a spicy, lightly peppery, alcohol finish. Full, velvety body with soft, slightly prickly carbonation. Perfect balance of sweet apple and green tartness with alcohol. Absolutely wonderful.

Pours a dark orange yellow.  Not much sparkling about it.  Aroma is intense tart and sweet apple.  Taste is much the same, a really great balance of the sweetness and the tart of fresh apples.  Need more.

Une autre surprise damis de longue date lors dun bbq pour fêter, entre autre, ma dernière année en tant que trentenaire.  Donc, une bouteille de 375 ml partagée entre certains convives et un petit verre de ce liquide bien doré qui, ma foi, me semble peu effervescent à loeil.  Une fois rendue au nez, cest lhabituel bouquet de la maison qui frappe avec délicatesse.  Les pommes sont gorgées de sucre caramel et se permettent, bien sûr, des touches acidulées qui viennent apporter un certain équilibre.  Au goût, cest lagréable surprise de bulles assez actives qui volent la vedette.  Les saveurs sont alors bien chamboulées et les pommes semblent être tombées dans une fontaine de jouvance: une belle cohésion vivifiante et fraîche!  En bouche, le liquide est pur délice et sa prestance ravie mon palais.  En finale, une sensation mordante de ces fruits du verger qui semblent avoir nettement éte cueillis pour moi en cette journée où le plaisir est bien au-dessus de toutes les autres valeurs.

Thanks Fred.  Pours a clear medium gold with a white head and pretty lively interior carbonation.  Lovely nose of baked apples, caramel, honey, something else, fleeting.  Mouth is thicker than expected, sweet baked apple dumplings with brown sugar, honey.  Flavor profile is heavier and darker than the nose, very sugary.  A bit boozy.  Carbonation is ample and prickly.  Given the presentation and that this is sparkling I think a drier profile would have been apt.  But La Face is amazing and this is still really good.

Sampled from the bottle. Poured a pale golden yellow with visible carbonation. Aroma had a nice combination of sweet and tart apples with a bit of acidity on the nose. Flavor was similar with sweet apples giving to tart apples that brought a nice acidity.

Purchased at the Mondial des cidres de glace SAQ 2011, February 12, 2011. Straw yellow, very effervescent. Aroma of apple juice and apple blossoms, slightly sour. Very sour apple juice taste,  but some sweetness, dry aftertaste. Not bad, a good spring drink!

Pouring at Le Mondial des Cidres Glaces.  Pours a clear gold.  Crisp apples and acid on the nose.  Bright and tart, nice clean acid and light carbonation work well together.  Lingering acid on the finish.  Bright and crisp.
